article_title: Republican Lawmaker Keeps a Lower Profile in a Bigger Role
article_text:
WASHINGTON—Rep. Patrick McHenry has gone underground.

When he arrived in Washington a decade ago, the North Carolina Republican was the youngest member of Congress, at 29. He needled Democrats, yelled on the House floor and pontificated on cable news.

Since he became House Republicans’ chief deputy whip last summer, Mr. McHenry hasn’t so much as spoken at a Washington news conference. The engine of a team responsible for...

twitter.description: Republican Rep. Patrick McHenry, once a firebrand known for tangling with opponents and pontificating on cable news, has taken on a lower profile even as he has vaulted to the party’s House leadership.
twitter.creator: @kristinapet
